revised_title: Fundamental Limits to Mass Comparison by Beam Balance: A Theoretical Analysis
tldr: This article explores the fundamental limits to mass comparison using beam balances, focusing on the effects of ground vibration noise and quantum fluctuations. The author presents mathematical models of knife-edge and flexure-strip balances to analyze their sensitivity and susceptibility to tilt and horizontal ground vibrations. The study concludes that the precision of weighing is currently limited by ground vibration noise, but knife-edge balances can potentially achieve a resolution of tens of nanograms.
